name: Pennyroyal
climate: Pennyroyal thrives in temperate climates with mild summers.
It can tolerate cool climates but may struggle in extreme cold.
Avoid planting in regions with excessively hot temperatures.
High humidity areas can promote healthy growth without stress.
sunlight: Prefers full sun but can tolerate light shade during hot afternoons.
Ensure at least 6 hours of direct sunlight for optimal growth.
In very hot climates, provide some afternoon shade if needed.
Avoid deep shade as it can lead to weak and leggy growth.
watering: Water Pennyroyal regularly to keep the soil consistently moist.
Avoid waterlogging as it can harm the plant's roots.
During dry periods, increase watering frequency for best growth.
In winter, reduce watering to prevent root rot from excess moisture.
soil: Well-drained soil with a mix of sand, loam, and organic matter.
Ensure good drainage to prevent water accumulation and root rot.
Prefers slightly acidic to neutral pH for optimal nutrient absorption.
Avoid heavy clay soils unless amended with organic material.
toxic: Pennyroyal is toxic if ingested, particularly in large quantities.
Essential oil is especially potent and should be handled with care.
Toxic to pets if consumed and can cause serious health issues.
Symptoms include vomiting, seizures, and even liver damage.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning helps maintain a compact and healthy shape.
Mulching can help retain soil moisture and suppress weeds.
Monitor for pests like spider mites and treat promptly.
Use caution when harvesting to avoid skin irritation from oils.
